inn1.comm: Vaas right on the button, a bit full, and Gilchrist drives to mid-off
Vaas strays to leg, Gilchrist flicks it into the on side, Fernando coming round from long leg misfields but no chance of a second
good line and length, firmly played back to Vaas who cannot get down quickly enough, mid-on ambles round to intercept
Hayden hits back firmly and Vaas stops around his feet
again Vaas drifts to leg, Hayden shimmies towards the off and clips the ball to long leg
good ball - almost 80mph - and Hayden takes no risks and defends solidly
right on target - 85mph - Hayden solidly into line
Hayden drops the ball into the leg side and scurries through for a quick single. Good calling, no danger as midwicket misfielded
Gilchrist whips it off his toes but slap-bang to midwicket. 86mph, he's cranking up the pace ...
leg-side, off Gilchrist's bat and then rump, long leg mops up
better line, pushed into the covers, a loud and quick "no"
Hayden fends rather uncertainly into the leg side, midwicket in very quickly to prevent the run. That was more about self preservation than the single
Gilchrist back and defends into the covers
the fireworks start ... Gilchrist flicks that dismissively off his legs, it was in the air but to the right of long leg, one bounce for four
and again ... this time Gilchrist hits it on the up over wide mid-on and it carries the rope by a couple of yards
Vaas pegs the batsman back with that one
again Gilchrist kept cramped, all he can do is push to point
run down to third man, good running gets them two despite a good throw
right up there, on off, and Hayden defends that down off the back foot, picking up his chewing-gum chewing momentum to boot
straighter and that's defended down into short leg
back of a length again, good pace, and that's defended down in front of him once more
Malinga bounces in, as does his hair, and again plants that on a very good length, leaving Hayden little option but to defend
a touch outside off and that's cut down, defensively, into the off side
over the wicket, by the way, and he shoots that one across Hayden, on a great length, and Hayden shoulders arms with a whirly-bat motion
on leg and that's immediately tucked off the hips and turned through fine leg
outside off, nips away off the seam, a hint of extra bounce surprises Gilchrist who tries to cut, but plays under the ball
cheeky single, into short midwicket, and "Yeahyeahyeahyeahyeah" - I think they want a run - they shuffle through
on off, up there, and that's defended on the back foot
on off and Hayden crouches over that one in defence, like shooing at a spider with a broom
outside off, a touch too short and that's helped on its way through cover - Hayden quick to drive uppishly over the inner ring
up there, a quiet defence
strange kind of shot, taken from off and driven to mid-off with a crouching drive
quick single, well taken, and it's Hayden to face
straight and Hayden defends tidily back
forces him onto his back foot and he defends back down
Malinga allows no room once more, and that's planted on a familiarly good length, Hayden just defending down
just the slightest hint of width, a hintette, and Hayden tries to force that into the covers, but it's on a very good length, and he can't get the ball away
a hint of width first up and that's deceived the crowd - gully parrying up the ball to the lurking point behind, but it was a bump ball, thumped into the ground
driven straight to the man at cover
a touch short, on off, and Gilchrist pulls that from outside off in front of midwicket, Maharoof doing well, diving to his left, to cut the ball off
oh, a swing and a miss, Hayden rushing what would have been a huge off-drive at one which flicked past his outside edge, with a hint of swing
comes a touch wider from his crease, and that's a tighter angle in at Hayden, who drives that back to mid-off
too short and too wide, too, just outside off and that's pulled strongly in front of midwicket and there was no need to run for that, as Hayden immediately realised
on leg and Gilchrist tucks that tidily off his hips through midwicket - and they run both  of those very quickly
plays right over that one, which is straighter, in defence
on leg this time, Gilchrist tucks it off his hips and will they run? "Nooo!"
outside off, some lesser-spotted width from Malinga, and that's driven slowly into the covers
worked away off the hips but there's cover at deep square leg
pushed right up there, straight, and defence is the best form of defence
on leg, asking to be tucked off the toes, and the batsman obliges with a sweet dink
up there and Hayden looks to thump that through midwicket, but hasn't timed that properly, and it just crashes into the ground
outside off, and that's driven straight to the covers
short and Gilchrist is quick to pull that high over midwicket, but it's picked up inside the boundary
outside off, and that's a cracking drive to gully, and some equally tidy fielding by Arnold, picked up snappily. Well done everyone
tracer bullet stuff, Gilchrist's hand and eye coordinating well as usual with an aerial off-drive that races
decent delivery, up there on off and that's simply defended forward by Hayden
cramped him for room there, Hayden would have liked to have driven that through the covers, but his wish wasn't granted
cutting in at him on off and Hayden drives that straight, Vaas doing well to get hand on it to stop it
on off and that's in the air but away from the cover fielder
slowish delivery dug out and then lifted over mid-on for a quick single
up there and that's tucked into short midwicket without much power
low full toss and, like an unruly ASBO holder, they're not the easiest to deal with - but he gave it the treatment with a sweet spank to long-off
dropped. Hard, but it's got to go down as a chance, as they say - slapped straight to the bowler's ankles. He clutches, vainly
full toss on leg and that's swiped through midwicket - where the fielder nearly stops the boundary, but can't quite
the beast is unleashed. A half-volley and that's lashed through long-on
that's big. Gilchrist just steps down and takes the ball from short on off and launches it over long-on
outside off, too wide, and Gilchrist eases that into the off side off the back foot
ooh quick and straight, rapping Gilchrist on the pads and the ball bobbles out to into the off side
a quicker one, fuller too, which Gilchrist again misreads, rapped on the pads. The ever erudite, enthusiastic Sangakkara roars an unlikely appeal
down the leg side, but only just...harshly wided by the umpire
ooh I'll have that - rapped on the pads, much straighter this time and Murali likes the appeal. The umpire does not
whipped through midwicket for a cheeky two
too short, Hayden is back onto his stumps and whipping it with a crack through midwicket
Murali roars the day's most angry appeal, demanding that the umpire raises his finger, but it pitched well outside leg
too short, he skips back and cuts it hard behind point
very neatly played by Gilchrist, taking one fleet-footed step down the pitch and timing it without trying to hit it too hard, down to long-on for a single
straighter - better from Dilshan, cramping the batsman for room, and it's cut, without power, into the covers
no no no, too short, Gilchrist clunks it off the back foot down the ground
squirted on the front foot out into the leg side - a spongy, squirty sort of shot, never getting hold of it
and a better line from Dilshan with which to finish the over, straight, forcing him forward and it's defended on the front foot
in the air - ooh, just short of mid-off there, and such was its timing (and the rather sloppy fielding) that he picked up a single
swept to deep backward square
not very convincing from Gilchrist there, waiting, waiting and waiting for it off the back foot before, at the very last moment, guiding it to point
too short from Murali and it's cracked into the covers
and Hayden goes for his first big Murali-mow over midwicket but it's too full, and he gets an inside edge down to Jayasuriya at fine-leg. Super running brings them two
clunked down the ground
huge from Gilchrist, absolutely vast six, skipping down the pitch and smacking him dead straight back over Dilshan's head
bat-padded away; Dilshan skips to his left to field and, before doing so, raises his arms in an appeal before realising how daft it was
quicker and flatter, pushed back to him
a leg-side drifted which is nicely, easily nudged off his pads for a single
oh, that's poor from Sri Lanka. A dreadful ball down the leg side, Sangakkara can't do anything to stop it and nor can fine leg
Hayden comes irritably down the pitch, desperately trying to clunk his way into rhythm

oh it's gone. It's gone long, very long - into the second tier of the stand over Dilshan's head. That was massive. A calm skip down the pitch, and a ferocious swing of the bat, the ball very nearly smacking into the camera in the stands
swept around the corner
full, flat, quick and defended off the back foot
but Murali loses his line once again, down the leg side, and Gilchrist sweeps

beaten! The doosra from Murali, turning back into Hayden who completely misread it, coming forward and trying to smack it down the ground. The ball crept through his bat and pad, very nearly knocking out his off stump
again wided down the leg side
smacked back to him but Murali does well, diving to his right
nearly! Very nearly bowled him there, super effort from Fernando, a slower ball which Gilchrist completely failed to pick
catch, catch it, a catch is on for long-off - but no! It sails over his head for six to bring up the pair's hundred partnership
magnificent shot - quite beautifully timed, on-driving it with ominous power back past the vainly-diving Fernando for four
that's poor - Sri Lanka are beginning to lose control here. It's down the leg side and rightly wided
another leg-side gift which Gilchrist accepts with glee, flicking it with a turn of the wrists through midwicket
good one to Hayden - a slower ball which Hayden, so heavily footed, is almost beaten by, defending it with an ugly poke away from his body
cracked to long-off to end another expensive over
and he goes for it, down on one knee, swinging it through midwicket
swept once more
quicker and flatter, defended off the back foot
a touch more flight, Gilchrist is back and across, defending it fairly certainly
but there he goes, and it's another huge slog-sweep over midwicket, in front of square. It's gone 10 rows back - a vast hit
clunked through midwicket for a single. Oh no, they're coming back for two - but Gilchrist has slipped mid-pitch...but no alarm, the fielder can't quite get it back in time

oh, that's poor luck for Sri Lanka. Hayden has looked remarkably scratchy so far today, almost nervous - and he is given another slice of fortune with a careless slap which takes a thick outside edge down to the vacant third man
again outside-edged to third man
brilliant...brilliant shot, staying back in his crease and late-cutting it just beyond the scrambling Sangakkara. Perhaps fortunate...but it looked deliberate enough to me
good comeback from the bowler, pitching it up and daring the batsman...who drives it cleanly through to cover
nice idea, poorly executed. Oh poor old Sri Lanka, they're not they're usual chipper selves and it's all rather going wrong for them. Wided outside the off stump
full, straight, guided down to third man
and Gilchrist flays it, absolutely lacing it down to third man
Vaas over the wicket to Gilchrist, short of a length, pushed back to the bowler on the back foot
pushed to cover, quiet start here
on the pads and that's flicked away to the deep square fielder for a single

on the off stump, Hayden backs away and tries to bludgeon it to the off side, it's a slower ball and there's a little bottom edge to short fine leg for a single. That could have easily gone onto the stumps. The fact is it didn't
full ball, on off and middle, Gilchrist within striking range of a century, pushes it back tentatively to the bowler
slightly slower it seems again, on the pads, Gilchrist chips it dangerously and .. oh .. that could have easily gone to the short midwicket fielder but drops just short. Lady luck?

That is too imposing. Full ball on off, Hayden backs away and shows his brute force. Rocky and Hulk Hogan in one body, unleashes a mighty hoick over long-off and watches it sail over long-off for a six. One can say it wasn't well timed but it's maximum all the same
yorker length almost and Hayden digs it out for a push through the leg side for a single

What a way to bring it up! Full ball outside off and it's slapped ferociously over mid-offf for a four. A century off 72 balls in a World Cup final. Adam Gilchrist take a bow! This has been a sensational effort and Kensington salutes him in admiration. Eight fours and six sixes. Take that

Oh! Edged and a sensational catch from Sangakkara, or so it looked. Full ball, thick edge that flies to Sanga's left and he dives full length to pull off a stunner but the ball just couldn't say in the gloves when he hit the ground. That was an almost superb catch. Almost
full ball, slapped to the cover fielder

full on middle and leg, Gilchrist tries to flay it through the on side but the thick edge flies to third man. Drops short of the fielder again. He's edging them, they're going close but nothing more than that. What was that about fortune and the brave?
On the back foot, onto it in a flash, not that short but it's pulled away with utmost contempt. That shot had ruthlessness written all over it. Speeds away to the midwicket fence for a chilling four
Vaas losing his bearings here, down the leg side and Sangakkara is standing up. He can't get to it and that's another four down the leg side. Wides, five of them

short and again down the leg, Gilchrist needs no second invitation to pull it away. Thick under edge flies past the keeper for a four. This was off the bat and Vaas bleeding runs here. Too much for Sri Lanka's comfort
fuller and on off, much better, no room to work on and that's dug out to the off side
that's much better again, another yorker length delivery on middle and that give Gilchrist no place to free his arms. Dug out back down the ground
Sangakkara is back upto the stumps now that Vaas has found his line. Slightly full and wide outside off and Hayden lets it go unharmed
similar delivery, much better end to the over from Vaas and Hayden lets it through
some swing for Malinga, that's a good sign. Full and on middle, he's kept it tight for most of the day. Driven confidently but straight to cover

where did that come from? Backing away to a full ball on leg stump and lofts it over mid-off for yet another four. Cool and easy, the bat handle seems to have turned in his wrists but what adjustment that was

That is a cracker, an explosive hoick off a slower ball. Gilchrist takes a mighty swipe at a full ball on off and though he doesn't get the timing manages a four to midwicket, probably the longest boundary
drifting on the pads and pelted away to deep square for a single. This is Gilchrist's first ever World Cup hundred. He was run-out on 99 in the league game against Sri Lanka in 2003

Finally! Mahela Jayawardene pulls off a smart catch at cover and Hayden has to go. He tried to club it over the short extra-cover fielder but Mahela was waiting there. He timed his jump well and pulled off a double-handed take while in mid-air. Hayden's useful hand comes to an end. It was a 55-ball 38 but nobody will complain when your partner is going bananas at the other end.
Good first ball to get. Yorker length on middle and off. He somehow gets bat and pad together to keep it out
yorker length from Vaas, Gilchrist digs it out and drives it to mid-off for a single. He is on 119 and seems as if he's just getting set. A double-hundred in a 38-over clash? Who knows
on the pads and flicked away for a single. Ponting off the mark. Sangakkara is switching between standing up and standing back.
good length outside off, back cut straight to short third man.
another good yorker, Sri Lankans bowling as if it's the end overs now. They need to. Gilchrist has no room to free his arms and squeezes it out for a single to fine leg
over-stepping this time, nothing much has gone right for Vaas. Good length on the off stump and defended confidently to the covers
similar delivery, no over-stepping this time and Ponting pushes to the off side looking for a single. Can't pierce the gap, though
Good end to the over, Ponting glides it straight to point.
Fast and full on off, pushed back down the ground
around the wicket to the right-hander and Ponting takes the cautious approach, pushing to the covers and taking an easy single
fast and furious, Gilchrist pushes it back and the ball deviates off Ponting behind the bowler. The batsmen don't take a run
dot  ball to Gilchrist, now that's a surprise. Driven back to the bowler
swept away to square for a single, Jayasuriya keeping it tight
pushes his front foot forward and drives to the leg side
he starts around the wicket to the right-hander, as he has so often in this tournament. Full ball on middle and leg, driven to long-on for a single
over the wicket to the left-hander, full ball on middle, Gilchrist on his knees and sweeping powerfully to backward square leg
good ball, offspinner pitching on off and Ponting, on the back foot, can only get a thick edge to the off side. Well deceived that time
patted away  to the off side for a simple single

beauty of a ball from Murali, sharp chance for Mahela at slip but he can't get to it. Sharp offbreak to Gilchrist and prods tentatively. The edge flies to Mahela's left and it's low. Super ball, deceived
Again! This time Ponting has no clue against the doosra, another edge and again wide of Mahela. That was slightly wider
Awwwww! Jayasuriya fires it in but Gilchrist is waiting, on his knees with that broadsword, and unleashes a most awesome hoick over midwicket for a soaring six. That was huge and simply mighty
flicked away for a single
fast and full, patted to the off side
good faster one again, Ponting doesn't get the freedom to do much with it
tapped away to the off side
pushed to the leg side for a single. Ponting struggling to get the score ticking in this over but does it matter with Gilchrist going such great guns at the other?
outside leg stump and Ponting brings out a cute sweep to fine leg. Malinga can't cut it off and that's his first boundary
works away the offbreak to the leg side for a single
Whack! Slog sweep on his knees, high, very high, soaring to midwicket and two fielders converging but neither can get to it. It falls between them and they complete two
swept away efficiently for another single. This is a motoring
Ponting tries to sweep the offbreak but gets his front pad outside the line of off stump. Murali lets out an appeal but that can't be given
down the track this time and driven to midwicket for a single
full on middle and off, defended carefully to the off side
down the ground and tries to flay it over the bowler's head but the low trajectory allows only a thick inside edge to the leg side for a single
full on middle, Gilchrist on the back foot and thumps it to midwicket for a single
full ball on middle, good bounce and Ponting tries to sweep it. Rapped on the pads and that's an appeal but it was probably too high
Brutal. Power and timing all the way to midwicket. Gilchrist down the ground in a twinkling flash and blitzes a smooth pendulum swing that soars the ball way over midwicket for a maximum
this is getting too easy. Full toss outside leg stump and paddled away cheekily past short fine for another four. What else can this man do? Anything actually
Swept away crisply to backward square leg
on leg and spinning away, Gilchrist swivels around and angles it to backward square for a single
on the front foot and flicking with the spin for a scampered couple. Malinga makes good ground but can't stop the brace
short and wide outside off, turning in, tapped away to the off side
goes for the launched slog sweep again but can't get the timing, ball strikes him on the back foot
slog swept to deep square leg to bring up the fifty partnership.
full ball angling into Gilchrist from round the wicket, he drives it through covers for a single
Fernando fires a full toss into Ponting's pads, he flicks but can;t beat the man at short fine leg, Gilchrist calls for the single, it was risky, had there been a direct hit he would have been out

finally finally they get Gilchrist out, Fernando bangs one short, Gilchrist swivels and tries to pull even though the length isn't short enough for the stroke, he gets a top edge and skies it straight to midwicket where Chamara silva takes an easy catch, Gilchrist leaves to a rousing ovation, he;s played one of the great World Cup innings
fullish delivery on the pads, Ponting moves across his stumps and flicks to deep midwicket
angled into the pads once more, Sangakkara collects it behind the stumps
good length ball but the line is poor, down leg side, Ponting flicks to deep backward square leg for one more
dabbed with soft hands towards cover for a sharp single
Jayasuriya fires that flat and fast into off stump, Symonds goes on the back foot and drives to long off
fullish delivery outside off stump, Ponting drives firmly to cover where Dilshan dives to his left and makes an excellent save
Jayasuriya bowls it quick into Ponting's pads, he tries to flick but misses, Jayasuriya appeals for lbw but it was missing leg
full toss outside off, Symonds thumps it down the ground for a single, it all seems rather quiet now that Gilchrist is out
fired into the pads once more, Ponting tries to sweep but doesn't make contact
Fernando finds the blockhole outside off stump, Symonds squeezes it towards cover on the front foot
lucky break for Symonds, he tried to heave it down the ground but got an inside edge past the stumps and down to fine leg
slowish delivery from fernando, Ponting aims to heave it on the leg side but gets an outside edge down to third man
poor ball, full toss down leg side, wide called but he's lucky that Ponting didn't put that away
fullish length outside off stump, Ponting drives but the timing isn't good, he collects one to mid off
tight line from Fernando, keeping it on a good length outside off stump, Symonds drives to mid off for one more
oh Fernando finishes with a slower ball that's a bouncer as well, Ponting gets into position for the pull but realises that he's far too early for the shot and bails out at the last moment
Symonds jumps down the track and hammers a full toss back past Jayasuriya, it technically was a catch but you'd have to be extremely brave to try to catch that
played to midwicket for a single
effortless from Symonds, he steps down the track again, gets to the pitch of the ball and hits through the line, he lofts that clean back over the bowler's head, superb placement
defended to midwicket, that was very quick from Jayasuriya and in the blockhole
another one in the blockhole, that's two yorkers in a row, Symonds drives this to cover
flat and fast outside off stump, Symonds pulls out the reverse sweep but can't beat short fine leg
fired into off and middle stump, Ponting makes room and drives down to long on for a single
streaky stuff but Symonds will take it, he gets his front foot out of the way and tries to loft it over cover, the outside edge flies down to the third man fence, Malinga winces
full and fast, homing in on middle and leg stump, Symonds plays it through midwicket
awesome strike, that's not as full as the others, Ponting uses the length to free his arms, he lofts that effortlessly over midwicket for six, outstanding timing
full toss on leg stump, Ponting turns it to short fine leg for one
Malinga strays on to the pads once more, dangerous line while fine leg is in the circle, Symonds flicks off his toes but straight to the man at fine leg
full and straight on off and middle stump, Symonds backs away and drives to long off for one
whoops, that's nearly a waist high full toss, Ponting makes room and drives through cover point for two more, Bucknor has warned someone for running on the pitch, looks like it's Ponting
driven down to long off for one

direct hit runs out Ponting! Symonds stepped down to a full toss and hit it hard to Jayawardene at cover, he called for the single and Ponting responded, Jayawardene took his time, aimed the throw at the batsman's end and hit the stumps, Ponting didn't wait for the umpire's decision, he was short by a long way
driven down to long off for  a single
sloppy stuff from Malinga who dives over Symond's paddle-sweep at short fine leg to allow the batsman two runs when there should have been just one or ideally none
excellent yorker, Watson jams his bat down in the nick of time and squeezes it towards mid on, the fielder is in the deep at long on and Symonds pounces on the chance to take two runs, superb running

bowled him! Shane Watson moves across and tries to play a cheeky paddle sweep over short fine leg, he played it extremely well against New Zealand, but Malinga is too quick for him, Watson doesn't make contact and the ball hits middle and leg stump
Clarke drives it to cover and sets off for an easy single, but hang on, Aleem Dar signals dead ball and asks the batsmen to go back, I think he's penalising Clarke for running on the pitch
full and straight on middle and leg stump, Clarke drives it firmly down to log on and nearly bumps into Symonds while trying to avoid running on the pitch
screaming yorker from Malinga, Symonds jabs down at it in the nick of time and sneaks a single towards cover
Malinga tries to find the blockhole once more and strays down leg side, Clarke tries to flick but gets more of an inside edge that beats the man at short fine leg and runs down to the fence
full and straight, very hard to hit, Symonds drives down to long off for a single
Fernando bowls a slower bouncer, Clarke is beaten by the change of pace but the umpire signals wide because that was too high, that's pretty harsh
full toss outside off stump, Clarke backs away, frees his arms and lashes it through point for one
excellent yorker from Fernando but he's overstepped

what's going on here, Fernando bowls another yorker, Clarke digs it out and back to the bowler, Symonds sets off for the run but realises that Fernando has the ball, Fernando turns around and only has to roll the ball on to the stumps to dismiss Symonds, he misses and the Australians run an overthrow
short ball, that was the slower bouncer once again, Symonds pulls it with one hand to midwicket
good length ball outside off stump, Clarke drives to long off for a single
excellent ball to finish, the yorker homes in on leg stump, Symonds backs away and digs it out, they run a single to short fine leg to finish tthe innings

inn2.comm: What a start! Walking down the track to Bracken and slashing a wide one through the covers for a four. Start as you wish to go along.
Hint of swing that time, fuller and outside off. Tharanga shoulders arms.

played and missed that time, Bracken has used the new ball well all through the tournament. Pitched up outside off and Tharanga can only tentatively poke at it, beaten all ends up, good carry to the wicketkeeper
good length ball, swinging away and moving after pitching too, left alone by Tharanga
full ball, swinging away but Tharanga reads it well and presents the full face of the bat. Finds the gap through extra cover and hurries for a single
Short of a length and outside off, moving away too. Jayasuriya lifts his bat as if to slash but backs away in the end and lets it through to the wicketkeeper
Short and slingy. 147.2kph and Tharanga scuds down below it. That was a speedy start. Again, start as you wish to go.
That's down the leg side, Tharanga can't get his bat to it as he tries the flick. Tait tends to be a bit erratic and that's the first wide
More swing, into the left-hander this time and Tharanga is beaten. Inside edge trickles away to fine leg for a single
More swing, full and on off, coming into the left-hander and giving him no room whatsoever. Dug out and driven back to the bowler

short and angling away from Jayasuriya, he lets it go to the wicketkeeper, that same wicketkeeper who unleashed a power-packed gem earlier in the day. I mean, 149 in a World Cup final. Now that's called making a statement
Full and on off, driven confidently but straight to mid-off

fast and slingy, he's been cranking it up throughout the over. Pitched on leg stump and rapped on the pads, Jayasuriya doesn't have the time to flick it away. Huge appeal for lbw but Steve "slow death" Bucknor doesn't budge.

That's more swing, and that's all over. Short of a length and Tharanga doesn't know whether to go forward or back. Stands rooted to the crease and simply pushes his bat limply, the edge is taken and Gilchrist snaps up a regulation catch behind the stumps. That's the first wicket for Australia and it was all to do with the length. Bracken strikes.
Some swing again, Bracken striking a wonderful rhythm now. Outside off and moving away and Sangakkara looks to leave but the ball deviates off the thickish edge and speeds to third man dfor a single

Width offered and the broad Jayasuriya blade goes for the rapacious slash, it comes off the middle of the bat and races away to cover for a sizzling four. He's standing way outside the crease to negate the swing and all he needs it some room to let the bat do the talking
beauty of a response from Bracken, changes his length and keeps it slightly shorter, moving away and leaves him wondering whether to go forward or back, beats him all ends up
straight and angling into the pads, a bit quicker too and strikes Jayasuriya high on the pads. No room is the best policy
full and swinging into the left-hander, Bracken mixing it up well. Jayasuriya tries to flick it to the leg side but is again struck on the pads, can't get it away
short of a length from Tait and Sangakkara stands tall and drives it sweetly through point for a fine four. Mimimum effort and he stylishly puts it away

short ball, speedy gunslinger this boy as he touches 90mph Sangakkara goes for the pull but is beaten for pace and can only get a thick top edge. Luckily it doesn't balloon up to the fielder and falls in no-man's land at wide mid-on
down the leg side, firing it down the pads and it's called wide

Full and wide, 90.9mph and Sangakkara throws his bat out but it's way too wide and he can only get a thick edge that bounces in front of second slip. That could have been another wide, instead it was a dot.
Short again, that time it's 94mph and Sangakkara can't time the pull too well again, trickles to the fielder in the in-field
full and on off, tapped to the off side for a quick single. These are quick grenades from Tait and Sri Lanka need to be on the look-out
short and well directed, Jayasuriya not given the freedom to free his arms and is on his backfoot keeping the ball away to the off side
short of a length, from over the wicket and angling into the left-hander's body. Tucked away watchfully to the on side but straight to the square fielder
full this time, on middle and leg and driven crisply to short midwicket. Plan seems to be: See the new ball off and then try to accelerate.
Slower ball this time and driven straight to the fielder at square leg
good ball that time, pitched on off and swinging away. 133kph but the bounce is disconcerting for Sangakkara who pushes his bat and is beaten
tapped to the off side but straight to the fielder. Gaps, Sanga, gaps are essential
full ball on off and homing in on off and slightly outside, tough to do much with those. Sangakkara takes the most sensible option and defends it watchfully
Thwack from Jayasuriya and that's a four. Too full and slightly wide, that's enough for Sanath to flay it mercilessly through extra cover for a cracking four
short and directed on the body, 92mph that time and Jayasuriya does the sensible thing: angles his bat and judders it down to third man

short again and Sangakkara pushes to the off side for a quick single, Clarke - mopping up at point - goes for the direct hit at the bowlers end but mis-field from Hogg, who is backing up. They manage another run

dropped by Watson. Short one and Sangakkara upper-cuts it over the slips, only for Shane Watson to try to get under it. He lunges forward but can't take the catch cleanly. Did he just drop the World Cup? Surely not you say
Slash, that was full and wide and Jayasuriya brings out the rapier, creaming a most brutal square drive. Rubbing salt into Watson's wounds, who mops up from third man
four more and Sanath is motoring along now. Short and outside off, Jayasuriya simply carves it over the slip cordon for another four. This is what they need now, sensible whacking
short of a length and Sangakkara tries to pull but can't make contact
thick inside edge goes to fine leg, batsmen complete a single
cramping him up by firing it down on his pads, tucked away to the leg side for a single. They think of too but Hussey is just too quick. And he's close to 50 isn't he?
defended off the back foot back to the bowler, good length from Bracken, giving nothing away
more short of a good length, more backfoot defence from Sangakkara, more atmosphere building at Kensington, more pressure piling on Sri Lanka, more ...
full and outside off, tap goes Sanga and straight to Ponting at short extra. Bracken has done a fine job. It's Tait who Australia might worry about. Time for GD McGrath?
short of a good length, outside off (typical McGrath), left alone
similar length, on off, patted back to the bowler
swing and wide, really wide (is that Mcgrath or Tait?). It swings even after passing Jayasuriya and Gilchrist (I can do nothing wrong today Gilchrist) pulls off a fine save behind the stumps
short of a length and outside off, a bit of swing too and Jayasuriya lets it go to the keeper

flicked away to the leg side and they had decided on two anyway, Hogg fires it in running in from square leg but the throw is slightly wide of McGrath. A more accurate one would have surely had the batsman in trouble
defended watchfully to the off side. McGrath doesn't give you much leeway and it's best to start watchfully against him
slightly fuller but still outside off, Jayasuriya shoulders arms
full and drifting into the pads, tucked away cutely to the square leg region for a couple

Now that was close, perilously close. Faster this time from Watson and short of a length, Sangakkara tries to work it to the leg side but a leading edge balloons up towards short mid-off. There's a fielder in there close but neither him nor Watson can get to it
short of a length, on off, driven confidently to point but no run
full ball on middle, driven to mid-on. Gaps, Sanga, gaps. Yes, we've said that before but the rate is mounting all the time
good length, on middle and off, no room and he tries to back away and cut. Straight to the point fielder again. Pressure, pressure. Can he get out of this mini-rut?
good end to a good over, tapped to the off side and Clarke moves across athletically and stops a single.
cut him in half that time, that was a super ball with swing and cut. Full ball, scrambled seam it seems and it pitches outside off and cuts Jayasuriya in half. Beaten all ends up
good length on off, no room for Jayasuriya and he cuts it straight to the point fielder
more swing, into the left-hander, thick inside edge to short fine leg but no run possible. The dots are piling up now
full outside off, driven hard but driven straight to mid-off. More dots
driven wide of mid-off for a quick single
defended back to the bowler
good length ball on middle and off stump, Jayasuriya tries to pull through midwicket but doesn't time it well
Watson bangs it short, too short, the ball balloons over the batsman's head and it's called wide
a fraction short on off stump, Jayasuriya goes on the back foot and flat-bats it towards mid-off
short of a length on off stump, Jayasuriya gets on top of the bounce and plays it to Clarke at point
run down to third man for a single
Watson is keeping it tight around off stump, not giving the batsman any room, played late with an open face for one more
short and wide outside off stump, you just cannot afford to give Jayasuriya width, he latches on to it in a flash and cuts hard past point for four
full length ball on middle stump, defended to mid on
Sangakkara gives McGrath the charge and tries to pull through midwicket, he mis-times it straight to the fielder
ambled single
McGrath pitches on a good length and angles it across Jayasuriya who heaves across the line and misses, Gilchrist collects the ball and thinks he's caught an edge, Bucknor doesn't agree
full ball on off stump, Jayasuriya squeezes it to cover
once again the length and line is immaculate, Jayasuriya dabs it with soft hands towards mid-off and sets off for a single
Watson bangs it in short, on the middle and leg, kicks up, Jayasuriya swivels, pulls, but the ball hits the bat rather than the other way and he gets it behind square
Jayasuriya goes down town. In style. Front leg out of the line and he biffs a length-delivery over mid-on.
Watson responds in the way I would have done. Goes for a yorker and ends up a wide outside off. Shocker. I am happy even the international bowlers do it.
ah!  back to regular programming. Bouncer. Well-directed stuff. Whooshes past the nose, outside off, left alone
short of length, on the off and middle, Jayasuriya, again, keeps the front leg outside the line and flat-bats it over the bowler's head. The runs are coming. In a hurry.
not for nothing he is the Matera blaster. Short of length and outside off and he carves it over point. Unadulterated hitting. Classic Jayasuriya.
missed outside off
rotates the strike back to Jayasuriya with a clip towards midwicket. What will Jayasuriya do now?
tip and run. He steals a single with push towards cover. So he is just not going to slog all the way.
another nagging length-delivery, around off and Sangakkara pushes it towards point
Sangakkara's best shot of the tournament. Charges down the track like a marauder and smokes a back of length delivery over deep midwicket.

The white ball is beginning to fly everywhere. This one whistled through cover. Fullish, outside off and Sangakkara went down on his knee to cream it through the off side. McGrath is getting the treatment. Now that's a surprise.
aha ... another one. McGrath hurls in a bumper, it rises chest-high, on the middle and leg, Sangakkara swivels nicely and pulls it behind square-leg.
length delivery, on the middle and leg, Jayasuriya lets it come to him, wrists it away past square leg
slips down the leg side, Sangakkara shuffles across, tries to tickle it away but misses. So does Gilchrist and it's three wides

ooh. Super shot. Backs away outside leg, Bracken sends it on a length, on the off and middle, Sangakkara maintains his balance, head still and the flashing blade comes down in a hurry and he square-drives it through point.
length delivery around off, no backing away this time, he quietly places it to point
swiped away. It landed well outside off stump, on length, Sangakkara reached out, on his knee and swung it across the line. Lots of gap in the midwicket region and he is pre-determining his assault

length delivery on the middle-stump line, slower one, Sangakkara shuffles across, laps it in the air behind square leg and Tait makes the stop. Again there is a gap there, he is thinking four but couldn't quite execute it properly.
played and missed
Sangakkara imparts more velocity to the projectile. Fast, full, on the off stump and Sangakkara stands tall and whips it through point. Lara would have been impressed. Game on!
from round the stumps, at the body, Sangakkara waits, wrists it to long leg. Easy single. Jayasuriya on strike. 184 to win in 22.4 overs.
chipped over midwicket. Fullish, on the middle and leg, Jayasuriya tries to clip it towards square leg but ends up chipping it over midwicket. 100 up.
Tait is not amused. Perfume ball but Jayasuriya is no mood to smell the leather and ducks under under it
here comes the attempted yorker. 89.7 mph. It doesn't quite land in the blockhole and Jayasuriya leans forward, drives down the ground.
full pitch, around off stump, pushed to cover
fullish, on the off stump line, driven to long-off

In the air but it lands in no-mans land. Sigh of relief must have been heard across Sri Lanka. It was a slower one, short in length, Jayasuriya went for a pull but didn't go through with the shot completely as he was surprised a touch by the lack of pace. It balloons up, deep midwicket fielder rushes in, square-leg fielder hurries back and it falls right in between them
no shot to one outside off
dabbed to third man for a single
charges down the track, tries to slog across the line, misses.
outside off stump, on a length, cut to third man for a single.
on a length, around off stump, turns away a touch, Jayasuriya waits and cuts it to deep point. Fifty up for him. Cheers go around the arena.
here comes the googly.  Hogg doesn't waste any time, does he? Landed on the off stump, broke back in, Jayasuriya dabs it away to the off side. Picked it off the turf.
flighted, on the middle and off, Sangakkara sweeps him on the length, to long leg
leans forward to a full delivery on the middle-and-off, bat in front of the pad, gets a inner edge to midwicket
another googly ... Jayasuriya, it appears, is picking it off the pitch rather than the hand. He is cramped up as he shapes to cut, the ball comes in and he ends up stabbing it away to point
eases forward, pushes a conventional legbreak back to the bowler.
fullish, outside off stump, Sangakkara doesn't move much, waits and carves it on the up to sweeper cover.

Gilchrist is standing up to the stumps. Full in length, slanting away from Jayasuriya who tries to slash it away on the up, doesn't time it well but still picks up a single as the ball darts to the cover region
slightly short, on the middle stump line, Sangakkara pulls it to deep midwicket
short and well outside off stump, Jayasuriya moves across, punches it through the off side region.
eye-catching stroke. Full on a length, on the off stump line, slanting away, Sangakkara moves back and across, waits and caresses it throught point. Nonchalantly played
retains the strike with a flick past square leg
swept to deep midwicket and there's his fifty

a huge, raucous appeal from Hogg - tongue slavering like a rogue monster - and that looks very plumb indeed as Jayasuriya is rapped on the back foot, but replays suggest it's sliding down the leg side by the thinnest of whiskers
wider of his off stump, allowing him a touch more room, and he pushes this to mid-on for a quick, expertly judged single
hammered on the front foot through extra cover, sweetly stroked with immense timing - and placed quite beautifully, bisecting the two on the boundary
just short of a length and Sangakkara's gem of a knock comes to a rather limp end, pulling a fuller delivery straight to the unddroppable hands of Ponting at short midwicket
and a neat, balanced flick through midwicket gets him off the mark
Watson, aka The Hulk, drifts this lazily down Jayawardene's leg stump who is back in his crease, deftly flicking this behind square
with absolutely no feet movement, he clatters it off the back foot to a deep extra cover on the boundary. No great timing there
delightfully stroked, a calm, elegant off drive to mid-off and slick running brings him a single
oh, poor ball from Watson - down the leg side and he flicks it, easily, neatly, past Tait at short fine-leg for four
an ugly mow across the line but straight to mid-on

pushed out to cover - Hogg, I believe it is out there, though I can't quite see - who flings in a very sharp throw to Gilchrist, and Jayasuriya is rather fortunate his captain is more aware than he is...sending him back in a hurry
very well bowled indeed, Hogg, tossing it up just above Jayawardene's eye line who backs away from the ball before clamping down on it
very neatly, classily played indeed, stepping away and angling it with little regard for the orthodox, down to third man
pushed out to cover
ooh a quicker one, excellent line here from Hogg and the left-hander is back and across, chopping it down at the last moment
terrific shot - a very bold stroke, in fact, sweeping it well in front of him, scooping it behind square for four
a surprise full toss which, surprise surprise, takes the batsman by surprise who unsurprisingly can't make anything of it, hitting it straight to mid-off
short of a length and clattered over midwicket with intent, if not placement
they're attacking Clarke here. Just short of a length and the captain swings at it, pulling it mercilessly but top-edging it just over midwicket
late cut past backward point. No - Hogg dives, quite brilliantly, to save at least two, and probably four
"Come on, Pup" screams Gilchrist to Clarke who drops this short, allowing Jayasuriya to clatter it off the back foot to long-on
too short, swung over midwicket and it falls safe of deep midwicket
goddim! A terrible shot from Jayasuriya, skipping down the pitch to a fullish delivery which just turned away from him, the ball keeping very low, and his off stump is knocked back
late-cut down to third man, deftly played
and he plays and misses at this - a good one outside off which rattles into the wicketkeeeper's gloves
ooh close once more, just a little wider of the off stump and he again plays and misses
just short of a length - wider, too - and he tries to uppercut it but again misses
elegantly driven on the front foot, opening the face of the bat down to third man
again late cut down to third man. Skillfully played...but Sri Lanka need a lot more than deft cuts at the moment
ooh a bouncer - a good one, were it not wide. But remarkably it's not called a wide - it sailed over the batsman's head who couldn't have reached it with two bats, let alone one
short, and he goes for a pull but he can't connect and it flies through to the wicketkeeper
a little fuller this time allowing him to come forward and pick it up down to long-on
sliced on the front foot, with one hand coming off the bat, to Clarke at backward point who is almost winded there, hit in the chest
uppishly spooned just in front of Clarke who treads cautiously around to field
on off, just back of a length and that's poked down to third man
rushes that one up there on off, it doesn't get up, but it's played too late with a straight bat
outside off, Jayawardene crouches into a neat cut and they shuffle through
a pretty wide down leg, the batsman swivels round to give game chase, but Bucknor correctly calls it
oh, nice nip of pace there, cutting back in at the righthander and popping just a touch, with a nice wristy cut and some quick running
comes forward and closes his bat down into his pad to squeeze out a quick single into short cover
on middle-and-leg and that's a throaty gurgle of a roar for lbw, and it looks like a good shout, and the umpire agrees
attempted yorker just to say turns into a very low and flat full toss, straight, which is swished off the toes to midwicket with a gentle nudge
round the wicket, floats that wide outside off. There's a full-blooded attempt to cut that, but he doesn't quite connect
top shot, really very good indeed. A half-tracker that just hits a squidgy part of the track and sits up innocently, only to be hooked with consummate timing, flat, over midwicket
dinked forward
on one knee and that's an attempted reverse sweep which finds the fielder
on leg and that's swept behind square. There's the "Hooo" part of an appeal but wzat's not out, missing leg
on leg and that's shuffled forward
dropped. That travelled back at face height, so Bracken did well to even clasp at it and get a hand to it
width outside off, Dilshan plants his left leg towards mid-on and opens up to give himself room to drive through cover. Great timing
gives himself room again, but this time picks out a fielder with the cover-drive
horrible delivery and help yourself - well turned off his thighs behind square, a very neat flick through fine leg
over the wicket and the batsman pokes out as that one seams past him and slightly away - Gilchrist whips the bails off but the stumping was never really on
over again and that's pushed across him once more, but with a touch more room and a flatter angle, so it's easily driven out to cover
slings that one in on middle and it's played forward into the covers
a touch of width, but that's cut straight to the fielder and without much power either
a slither of room outside off but Dilshan forces it out to cover
on off and there's a mistimed pull up towards mid-on, not at all where he intended that to go
the batsman steps back as the bowler runs in, and then strides into a flashing cover-drive which again picks out a fielder
low full toss and that's swiped away with a deliciously timed pull through midwicket - clean shot, cool result
he's still got the fire and bangs that one in, which doesn't lift because of the bogginess of the wicket and it's muscled into short midwicket
pings that one in on that maddening length he favours, and the batsman steps back to swipe on his back foot, and connects with air only
that one cuts in off the seam, there's a dab down and a tip-and-run to make coaches everywhere proud
short and that's pulled easily and with great timing through midwicket
a testing delivery, a bouncer which follows the batsman and he backs away enough at the end

on off, quicker than expected, and that was tucked down to third man. Some great work from Clarke and McGrath there, as Dilshan slipped on setting off - a throw heading just towards the stumps, McGrath takes it in front and takes off the bails
down leg and that's a really wide
comes down and swats the air with a huge swipe aiming for midwicket. Misses it completely and the ball plinks into the sticks
outside off, cut down, and McGrath tiptoes across at third man - it's immensely boggy down there - to pick up the ball
up there and that's driven slowly to cover where Clarke races around to pick up the ball one-handed. Good racing
too late on that shot, cutting over it
down the off channel again and once more aims a slash at that one, this towards cover, but it goes through to Gilchrist
"Oh yes, Clarkey!" cries Gilchrist as the batsman is tucked up yet again, Clarkey no doubt whispering a bedtime story of goodnight while he's at it
McGrath finds some hostility again, a straight bouncer that's well poked down late, off the back foot
on leg and that's worked into short midwicket
tried to steer that one - on middle - into midwicket, but realised the length was tidy and stopped on the shot
short and pulled up, but safe, into midwicket
nasty ball, especially in this light - a full toss above the waist. But Australia, including McGrath, just smile as Arnold pops up an edge off a pull to Gilchrist... and takes his international bow
up there and that's tucked off the legs to square for an easy run
a quick single, for what it's worth
that one stays low as it slinks down the off-side channel
swats at that one, aiming a heave off the back foot to cover
aerial drive over long-off
now that's a big one. Malinga's got a great eye, dancing and leaning into that one to sail it over long-on with an admirable aerial drive
width outside off and that's worked out off the back foot to gully
outside edge through backward point. Even the TV cameras are struggling to follow this
slogged to midwicket
gently floated up, driven to long-on
driven back to Symonds who hears it coming towards him and fields
flicked to midwicket
a big swing and a miss, Gilchrist whips off the bails, Dar calls for the third umpire as he could never have seen that far with any certainty
floated up and blocked
driven to long-on
padded into the off side
forward defensive shot
blocked again, almost mocking the umpires
missed sweep down the leg side, Dar signals a wide to the delight of the umpires who feel he has behaved like a complete fool
sorry, no idea as we simply could not see
left alone
blocked
swung into the leg side
missed and off the pad
missed, padded into the leg side
missed, a loud appeal, not out but mercifully it's all over and Gilchrist lets out a roar
